entry.title: 34::366 - Explaining
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien told me about some frustrations on the last night of my 34th year alive. This is the last photo in my third 365 set.

entry.title: 34::365 - Tromping in SF
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tonight, Ryan and I grabbed some beers and walked up to Golden Boy pizza.

entry.title: 34::364 - January by the bridge
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

On Dec 26 I dropped my D800 onto the carpet from merely 2 feet. I thought nothing of it, but realized soon afterwards that my 24-70mm was damaged enough that I can't use it anymore. Tonight I noticed that the body was not focusing correctly when …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

On Dec 26 I dropped my D800 onto the carpet from merely 2 feet. I thought nothing of it, but realized soon afterwards that my 24-70mm was damaged enough that I can't use it anymore. Tonight I noticed that the body was not focusing correctly when not used in live view. The fact that $5000 worth of photo gear was damaged by a mere two foot drop onto carpet is extremely disappointing for me. I won't be taking many photos with this camera until it's fixed, and I don't know when that will be.

entry.title: 34::363 - Tien's first fire
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I re-arranged the living room to accommodate the fire place tonight, and then made a fire. Tien had never had a fire in a fire place before, only while camping and in stoves and stuff. We sat tended the fire for a few hours since it …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I re-arranged the living room to accommodate the fire place tonight, and then made a fire. Tien had never had a fire in a fire place before, only while camping and in stoves and stuff. We sat tended the fire for a few hours since it refused to stay burning due to moist, dense wood.

entry.title: 34::353 - Tien's first time skiing
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I drove up to Ski Cooper today and I taught her how to ski. She did really well even though it snowed the whole time we were on the mountain and her fingers got painfully cold. Go Pro Hero 2 video footage is on …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I drove up to Ski Cooper today and I taught her how to ski. She did really well even though it snowed the whole time we were on the mountain and her fingers got painfully cold. Go Pro Hero 2 video footage is on my youtube channel.

entry.title: 34::352 - White Christmas
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

We have our Christmas on Dec 26th, so this still counts.

entry.title: 34::350 - Back in Colorado Springs
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I flew directly from SFO to COS today and landed in snowy Colorado Springs to spend the holidays with my family. Last year we were in Vietnam for the holidays where it was nice and warm at the beaches, this year it's sub zero …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I flew directly from SFO to COS today and landed in snowy Colorado Springs to spend the holidays with my family. Last year we were in Vietnam for the holidays where it was nice and warm at the beaches, this year it's sub zero white christmas in the mountains.

entry.title: 34::343 - Array

A bokeh sample of the Samyang 35mm ƒ/1.4 lens, close far focus. Notice how the bokeh balls are cut off with a hard line towards the top and bottom edges of the photo.

entry.title: 34::340 - Running from waves
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I was on the beach taking photos of the stars when a wave came up and I had to run away with my shutter open. Then I heeded the words of Victor Wooten and just made it groove.

Back up your data.

entry.title: 34::326 - In Transit opening
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I went to the In Transit opening tonight and I was hoping to meet some of the other local photographers. We met a few who were cool, but none of the ones I was hoping to meet. There were a lot of great photos …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I went to the In Transit opening tonight and I was hoping to meet some of the other local photographers. We met a few who were cool, but none of the ones I was hoping to meet. There were a lot of great photos on display, though I'd say the selection mostly or only showed the positive or romanticized aspects of Muni and disregarded the daily failures of the system. Incidentally, I was late to the show because I took Muni to get there.

entry.title: 34::322 - Ghosting with the Roundflash
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I got my Roundflash today and I'm so far impressed with its build. I have yet to get any good use out of it though, so I can't speak for its performance yet.

entry.title: 34::319 - Point Bonita and Mount Tamalpais
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I just realized today that I can see a lighthouse and an observatory from my house. I think that's pretty neat, a good reminder of man's accomplishments. This isn't the view from my house though.

I wonder if you could talk on FRS radios between Point …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I just realized today that I can see a lighthouse and an observatory from my house. I think that's pretty neat, a good reminder of man's accomplishments. This isn't the view from my house though.

I wonder if you could talk on FRS radios between Point Bonita and Land's End. Maybe next time I'll take my radios with me and see if anybody responds.

entry.title: 34::318 - Thanksgiving Dinner 2012
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Raymond and Willa invited Tien and I over for Thanksgiving. We watched the first Lord of the Rings movie, which Tien had not yet seen.

entry.title: 34::312 - Cleaning up the view
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Today this crew came and trimmed the bushes that block my view of the ocean. They'll grow back, but for now I have a slightly cleaner view from my window.

entry.title: 34::309 - Tarkhuna
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Last night I got into a conversation about liquor and wine with my landlord when he spotted me coming in with a brown bagged bottle. He showed me his wine cellar where he had a variety of wines and several spirits. He gave me this mostly …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Last night I got into a conversation about liquor and wine with my landlord when he spotted me coming in with a brown bagged bottle. He showed me his wine cellar where he had a variety of wines and several spirits. He gave me this mostly empty bottle of Tarkhuna. It is probably the best vodka I've ever had, so smooth. I can totally see how James Bond can suck down martini's if he's drinking stuff as good as this, or probably better.

Autumn is definitely the best season in San Francisco.

WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien, Raymond and I went to the Flugtag today, which I was really excited to see. Unfortunately the lack of visibility and seating made it tolerable for only a short while. It looked like it would've been a lot of fun for people who had a direct view though.

entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I'm too impatient to wait for the Rokinon Tilt Shift, so I'm resorting to my own methods for tilting this bokehlicious glass. I got an NEX-7, but I'm still waiting on my Kipon Nikon tilt adapter to arrive from HK, so I'm having to resort to freelensing in the mean time.

I made a quick video showing the IR in action and describe what the normal colors …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Today I received my Lifepixel standard IR converted D90! So far it's much better than the D70 was, I'm really enjoying it, and I haven't even taken it outside yet.

I made a quick video showing the IR in action and describe what the normal colors are of various objects around my house.

entry.title: 34::280 - Peripheral view
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I have this very slight view of the beautiful part of the Bay Bridge at my office. The left side of the window vignettes if you look through it even with your eyes. At least we get one tower.

entry.title: 34::275 - Lazy tree cat
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I encountered this cat right as I got off the 48 bus on my way home. He was napping, and I kept bothering him by pushing my camera in his face. I'm sure he wasn't happy.

entry.title: 34::273 - NEX-7
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

It's been a long time since I've bought a Sony product, and it felt kind of dirty doing so, but I'm mostly enjoying this camera so far and have some very specific plans for it that I'm pretty excited about.

WarzauWynn posted a photo:

In IR my wife's eyes change from dark brown to crystal blue.

entry.title: 34::263 - Rollerblading Violinist
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I was down at Embarcadero to photograph Critical Mass 20, but I was early and decided to leave when I found this girl rollerblading around by the California Street cable car turntable playing Moon River. I took a video and talked to her for a minute …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I was down at Embarcadero to photograph Critical Mass 20, but I was early and decided to leave when I found this girl rollerblading around by the California Street cable car turntable playing Moon River. I took a video and talked to her for a minute. I thought she might be like Gabriel Angelo, a music student who gets hours of practice in while making a little money and getting his name out, but that wasn't so. She had been in America visiting her father and was now traveling back to Vienna. As I took this photo she was playing Ein Klein Nachtmusik, quite appropriate for a girl from Vienna.

entry.title: 34::265 - Watching the sun set on a beautiful day
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

San Francisco must have been jealous of what Tien and I were saying about how great San Jose weather was yesterday compared to SF (35 degrees warmer) because today's weather was better than any day in recent memory.

entry.title: 34::261 - Blue truck
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I pass this truck every day on my way to and from work. It's a beautiful restoration that's ongoing. There used to be a truck bed but I guess it was taken off for restoration.

I got this nifty Samyang 35mm ƒ/1.4 lens today …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I pass this truck every day on my way to and from work. It's a beautiful restoration that's ongoing. There used to be a truck bed but I guess it was taken off for restoration.

I got this nifty Samyang 35mm ƒ/1.4 lens today and am really enjoying it so far.

WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Most of the time this bus shows up, but of course, being Muni, it don't always. Lucky me this morning, not so much the next.

Blake hiding behind his iPhone 5. It was this shot that made me realize that the new iPhones will probably serve great as white balance cards because the texture on the back of the phone isn't reflective.

entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Sea Biscuit decided to … I'm not sure yet. I' don't know if it's closed or if it's just being renovated. There was no sign indicating what was going on behind the paper.

Update: It has been remade into a wine-bar cafe. The couch, bookshelf, television, mug tree, ATM… all gone. Basically The Sea Biscuit is gone.

entry.title: 34::234 - Rocket with Pureview
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

My coworker Ali loaned me a Nokia Pureview. Its camera is very remarkable, but the rest of the phone is pretty lackluster. Plus, who wants a Meego phone anyway? Certainly not for more than $500, especially since that price demands RAW image support. Hopefully this sensor …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

My coworker Ali loaned me a Nokia Pureview. Its camera is very remarkable, but the rest of the phone is pretty lackluster. Plus, who wants a Meego phone anyway? Certainly not for more than $500, especially since that price demands RAW image support. Hopefully this sensor comes to other phones.

entry.title: 34::233 - Mithun Pal, August 2012
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Mithun and I went next door to The Gap HQ and tried to get up to their terrace, which we'd heard was public access, but were refused by the guards. To my surprise Mithun whipped out his mobile phone and called up his elite contacts on …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Mithun and I went next door to The Gap HQ and tried to get up to their terrace, which we'd heard was public access, but were refused by the guards. To my surprise Mithun whipped out his mobile phone and called up his elite contacts on the inside to get us past security and up to the grand view of the Bay Bridge above the bow and arrow. Quite a delight.

entry.title: 34::232 - Clear mornings
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

The weather has finally been getting nice lately with clear mornings and evenings. I rode my bicycle to work shortly after taking this photo. Such a beautiful commute through Golden Gate Park.

The air was unusually clear tonight, so I pointed my camera out the window and took some star pictures.

entry.title: 34::224 - My Steed
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I've done around 2k miles on this thing, I think it's time for a tune up. Muni has been so awful lately and the bright side of that is I've gotten the motivation to start biking to work again. Incidentally, it takes less time for me …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I've done around 2k miles on this thing, I think it's time for a tune up. Muni has been so awful lately and the bright side of that is I've gotten the motivation to start biking to work again. Incidentally, it takes less time for me to ride my bike across the entire width of San Francisco than it would for me to take the L or the 48 to the subway. Less commute time coupled with a workout and a cost of zero seems like a great deal to me.

entry.title: 34::219 - Honey
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Local honey is so much better than the stuff you buy in the grocery store.

entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I've been really inspired by Kim-Ngan Ao's photo stream, particularly the double exposures. I've been doing more of those since I got my D800, and today Tien and I sat for a while analyzing silhouette photos and talking about how to go about composing double …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I've been really inspired by Kim-Ngan Ao's photo stream, particularly the double exposures. I've been doing more of those since I got my D800, and today Tien and I sat for a while analyzing silhouette photos and talking about how to go about composing double exposure shots in regards to shapes, patterns and light.

entry.title: 34::214 - Saint Thomas the Apostle Roman Catholic Church
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Oh Christian God, please smite Muni with your mighty vengeance so that they may learn the error of their deceitful ways. Teach them that when a bus is scheduled to show up, it is a sin for one to not show up, but it is an …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Oh Christian God, please smite Muni with your mighty vengeance so that they may learn the error of their deceitful ways. Teach them that when a bus is scheduled to show up, it is a sin for one to not show up, but it is an abomination to miss two consecutive ones.

On a happier note, if either of the two 18's that were scheduled to show up had actually done so, I wouldn't have taken this photo. Also, if the river of the 31 hadn't completely ignored me when I motioned for her to open the door back up I wouldn't have gotten as good of a photo, because I took this right after she drove away and left Tien and I standing there in the cold windy fog.

entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

This 12 year old boy has been tapping and playing the trumpet at Montgomery Station lately. His name is Gabriel Angelo and he is studying at the San Francisco Conservatory and the Berkeley Jazz School. His infrequently updated blog is here: gabrielangelotrumpet.blogspot.com

In this shot he was marching past me playing Sway With Me, I think it was.

entry.title: 34::175 - Pacific Bell retrofit
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

From what I understand, this is a seismic retrofit of the historic PacBell building. It's a beautiful building, I've always wanted to take photos inside of it. I'm glad they're repairing it so it can survive the next big quake. According to Wikipedia, this is the …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

From what I understand, this is a seismic retrofit of the historic PacBell building. It's a beautiful building, I've always wanted to take photos inside of it. I'm glad they're repairing it so it can survive the next big quake. According to Wikipedia, this is the future home of Yelp.

Picked up this 18-55mm DX lens yesterday and was amazed at how well it worked on the D800 in FX mode. At 18mm it looks heavily vignetted like this, but from 22mm on it's much more gently stylized.

This shot had LR4's lens profile distortion correction applied, but not vignette removal.

WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Enjoy this, and all my future posts, in 2048 pixels.

Today I made my wife row me around the lake while I napped in the boat.

entry.title: 34::157 - M Ocean View Balboa Park
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

One year ago today I got my Canon T3i. I gave Canon a good, serious shot, but towards the end I felt it was crippling me creatively and I switched back to Nikon. A lot of talk goes into the Canon vs Nikon debate, but in …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

One year ago today I got my Canon T3i. I gave Canon a good, serious shot, but towards the end I felt it was crippling me creatively and I switched back to Nikon. A lot of talk goes into the Canon vs Nikon debate, but in the end, when you look at any photo you can't tell what brand of camera made it, so I say use your preferred tool and let others do the same.

entry.title: 34::152 - In search of a live oak tree

WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Mt. Hamilton is a poor destination for a picnic. You're not allowed to park anywhere but a few trailheads, and there are mostly open meadows with few trees that aren't on the side of a steep hill, which makes for poor picnicking.

I had lunch with Bri today. I hadn't seen her in over six months and we'd both gone on international travels in that time. Luckily mine didn't involve destroying a rental car in a river like hers did.

entry.title: 34::139 - Chris Bennett, May 2012
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I'm enjoying IR so much that I am thinking about converting my D5100 once I get my D800. It would have significant benefits over the D70 I'm using, such as live view for focusing using deeper IR filters, and higher megapixels. Also thinking about doing a …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I'm enjoying IR so much that I am thinking about converting my D5100 once I get my D800. It would have significant benefits over the D70 I'm using, such as live view for focusing using deeper IR filters, and higher megapixels. Also thinking about doing a full spectrum conversion to get the most possible light for B&W.

Chris and I went out and walked many miles around SF today. My pedometer showed over 16k.

entry.title: 34::131 - Party at the Park
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I wandered again through golden gate park, this time having a good talk about some similar experience we'd had in life. We came across this group if kids partying on the lawn and it was a relevant illustration to the conversation. It was such …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I wandered again through golden gate park, this time having a good talk about some similar experience we'd had in life. We came across this group if kids partying on the lawn and it was a relevant illustration to the conversation. It was such a beautiful day in the park, nice to see everybody out enjoying it.

entry.title: 34::129 - Hard Drive Surgery
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

After three years I managed to find identical hardware and firmware versions as my backup drive that got fried before my first trip to Asia. I transplanted the controller card and it spun right up allowing me to see all my lost data. So so happy …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

After three years I managed to find identical hardware and firmware versions as my backup drive that got fried before my first trip to Asia. I transplanted the controller card and it spun right up allowing me to see all my lost data. So so happy!

entry.title: 34::127 - Oatmeal Cookies
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

My wife made oatmeal cookies for the first time tonight.

As an exercise in sleuthing, using just this photo, can you deduce what continent she's originally from?

Tien rocking the IR D70 in GG park… but then the battery died.

First post from the Nikon D5100 that I picked up to hold me over until I get the D800. So far I like it much more than the T3i even though it's basically the same camera. Must be Nikon...

entry.title: 34::101 - First IR Portrait
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Today marks a new milestone for me. I shot Nikon for 15 years, then switched to Canon to see what it was all about. After shooting for nearly a year, I've decided that Canon is over-hyped, and I simply don't like it as much as Nikon …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Today marks a new milestone for me. I shot Nikon for 15 years, then switched to Canon to see what it was all about. After shooting for nearly a year, I've decided that Canon is over-hyped, and I simply don't like it as much as Nikon. With that, I'm switching back to Nikon, and doing so in style. This morning I picked up a Nikon D70, the first model of DSLR I ever owned, which had been converted to IR by Life Pixel. Like so many other people I'm waiting for my D800 order to be fulfilled, so this D70 should keep me occupied until then. I also picked up a 45mm PC-E ƒ/2.8 tilt-shift lens, which is something I've been missing since I got rid of my PC-E 24mm ƒ/3.5. As of today I'm back on Nikon, doing what I love, not just exploring the alternatives. So here's a photo of my lovely wife with light eyes and blue hair.

entry.title: 34::110 - Baseball game
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

My first pro baseball game, the Giants vs the Padres

entry.title: 34::107 - So long, Canon
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

It was here under the Castro flag that I sold my Canon T3i. I'm now officially back on Nikon.

entry.title: 34::106 - Sunset Reservoir solar farm
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

The city put a solar farm on top of the Sunset Reservoir. The iconic Golden Gate Bridge can be seen in the distance.

I love how many trees and parks San Francisco has, you can't even see the innumerable houses that are between the reservoir and …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

The city put a solar farm on top of the Sunset Reservoir. The iconic Golden Gate Bridge can be seen in the distance.

I love how many trees and parks San Francisco has, you can't even see the innumerable houses that are between the reservoir and the bridge.

entry.title: 34::105 - Chris Bennett after his first day at Twitter
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Went out for sushi with Chris and found out it was his first day at Twitter today.

entry.title: 34::99 - Nook Simple Sucks
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

So long, Nook Simple Touch. I can't say it was great. It was good, but not great… so much potential gone to waste because the lack of a full platform backing the hardware. Long live Kindle.

entry.title: 34::96 - Highway band
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Sunday Streets on the Great Highway is just like any other day that they close the highway, except they tell people about it and allow people to do things like setup a band on the crosswalk of the highway.

WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Some of these mornings are so beautiful, but my iPhone just can't capture the experience…

entry.title: 34::59 - Dolphin Watching
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

First day in the new place and I spotted two dolphins jumping out of the ocean from my living room. We ran outside to try to spot them and take photos or videos, but they didn't come back.

entry.title: 34::58 - Moving day
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I've done this a million times, but this was a first for Tien. At least we weren't driving hundreds of miles through snow storms towing a car or something else like I've done previously.

That polarizer sure adds interesting texture in B&W photos with UV filtering glass.

entry.title: 34::19 - Vietnamese Bananas
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

These taste different than the bananas you get in America. They're more sweet, with almost a vanilla flavor in there.

entry.title: 34::46 - Lunch with the AGU crew
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

This is my 4th trip to Vietnam, but the first time I've met any non-Vietnamese people who are living in An Giang. We're going back to America in 4 days and I wonder who will still be here next time we come back. Today we met …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

This is my 4th trip to Vietnam, but the first time I've met any non-Vietnamese people who are living in An Giang. We're going back to America in 4 days and I wonder who will still be here next time we come back. Today we met up for lunch with Vincent, Jillian and Andrea at Loi Xua.

entry.title: 34::45 - Night Market
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tonight, Tien and I went into LX to meet up with some of the AGU crew for what they call the Bullshit Speaking Club where we all eat dinner, drink beer and enjoy the company of other english speakers. We got there before anybody else though …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tonight, Tien and I went into LX to meet up with some of the AGU crew for what they call the Bullshit Speaking Club where we all eat dinner, drink beer and enjoy the company of other english speakers. We got there before anybody else though, so we went shopping at the night market.

WarzauWynn posted a photo:

When Tien and I came out of Vietnamese class we immediately spotted this big black butterfly fluttering back and forth between two trees.

entry.title: 34::40 - Nhu Shoes
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Nhu got some walking shoes now that she's aspiring to be mobile.

entry.title: 34::38 - Đền thờ Bác Tôn
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Since I'll only be in Asia for a few more weeks, I figure I should take some typical asian travel photos while I still have the chance. Here's the temple on Ong Ho island near Long Xuyen.

entry.title: 34::37 - Surprise! A roasted pig!
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien's cousin showed up with some other family and a roasted pig, so we had a little feast on the floor in the big room.

entry.title: 34::35 - Finish
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I was studying Vietnamese and Nhi was dancing with the Kinect. They've danced to every song we have a million times, it would be nice if some other interesting Kinect games would come out that have more content. We only have a few and they're getting …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

I was studying Vietnamese and Nhi was dancing with the Kinect. They've danced to every song we have a million times, it would be nice if some other interesting Kinect games would come out that have more content. We only have a few and they're getting played out.

entry.title: 34::33 - Little cousinettes
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I went with some of her family to visit her cousins in Long Xuyen. I always find myself paying attention to the children because vocal communication isn't such a large part of interacting with them, so we can still have fun despite speaking different …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I went with some of her family to visit her cousins in Long Xuyen. I always find myself paying attention to the children because vocal communication isn't such a large part of interacting with them, so we can still have fun despite speaking different languages.

entry.title: 34::32 - At a wedding party
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I went to a wedding party for a friend that she went to Jr. High school with and hadn't seen in over 10 years. It's interesting to me that in VN culture that is what happens, you invite the whole village to your party …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Tien and I went to a wedding party for a friend that she went to Jr. High school with and hadn't seen in over 10 years. It's interesting to me that in VN culture that is what happens, you invite the whole village to your party. The party was at a nice hotel next to the Coop Mart in Long Xuyen. The groom spoke english, which was nice because I could congratulate him myself.

entry.title: 34::31 - Toàn Thắng
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

This massage parlor only employs blind people, allowing them to have a normal job where they participate in society and earn their money rather than begging on the streets. Tien and I both got full body massages after studying today.

entry.title: 34::30 - Sisters, young and old
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

We went through old photos today and I found this one of Thu and Tien when they were little girls that was really adorable. I had them pose with it so we can see them young and old.

entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

More and more I am disappointed by the colors I get from the T3i. I'm not 100% sure that it's the T3i though, it could be that I'm editing photos on the less-than-amazing screen on the 11" MBA. I don't think so though, because it's much …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

More and more I am disappointed by the colors I get from the T3i. I'm not 100% sure that it's the T3i though, it could be that I'm editing photos on the less-than-amazing screen on the 11" MBA. I don't think so though, because it's much easier to get the colors right on images taken with other cameras. In any case, I'll be posting a lot of B&W until I get rid of this T3i.

entry.title: 34::25 - Tien's self portrait cake
entry.summary:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Today was Tien's 29th birthday, and since there's no cake shop in Binh Hoa, and since it's difficult for me to do things in secret, she ended up buying her own cake. She picked this one out because she said it looked like her, which I …
entry.content:
WarzauWynn posted a photo:

Today was Tien's 29th birthday, and since there's no cake shop in Binh Hoa, and since it's difficult for me to do things in secret, she ended up buying her own cake. She picked this one out because she said it looked like her, which I thought was absolutely adorable.

Last year was dinner at Bobo's Steakhouse, this year was dinner on the kitchen floor.

Tien says this fruit display is a Tet tradition.

entry.title: 34::18 - Burn

This is the only photo I took today, so I have no choice but to use it for my 365. I burned myself on a motorbike muffler on Monday night.

A lazy 365 before bed, staring at the ceiling through the mosquito net.

The market is mostly closed because of Tet.

WarzauWynn posted a photo:

WarzauWynn posted a photo:
